narrative.narrative: Ambica Airlines existed from March 10th,1947 until December 1949. Its base was Mumbai/bay,India. Its routes were Bombay to Vadodara onto Ahemedabad which totaled 464 kilometers and was done twice a week. Its other route was BOM to Rajkot onto Jamnagar onto Bhuj onto Morbi. This is 596 kilometers not including Morbi, which is the only one of these airports no longer around at 2016. That route was three times a week. The airline used mostly DC-3's and had three Beechcraft Model 18's as well. It had other planes but it is not recorded what kind. It closed due to low passenger numbers and legal problems.
